ilog.concert

Interface IloIsomorphism

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IloAddable, IloConstraint, ilog.concert.IloCopyable, IloIntExpr, IloNumExpr

    public interface IloIsomorphism
extends IloConstraint
    An instance of this class represents an isomorphism constraint.

    An instance of IloIsomorphism represents an isomorphism constraint. An alternative constraint is a 1-to-1 correspondence between the present intervals in array intervals and the present intervals of array domain. Two intervals in correspondance have the same start and end points.

    The constraint can be passed an additional set of |intervals| integer variables map with domains in [0..|domain|-1]U{absVal} that describe the mapping at the solution. If the interval at the ith position in array intervals is in correspondence with the interval in jth position in array domain then the ith variable of the array map takes the value j. The ith integer variable of the array map takes the value absVal if the ith intervals of array intervals is absent.

    A rephrasing of the previous formulation is: Each of the interval variables of domain is an alternative on intervals and each of the interval variables of intervals is an alternative on domain whose selected integer variable position is map.

    For more information on the isomorphism constraint, see the concept Intervals Isomorphism in the C++ Reference Manual.

    • Method Summary

      • Methods inherited from interface ilog.concert.IloAddable

        getName, setName
